section: 8.1 TERM.  The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement.  A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect.  In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: This section details the term of the agreement and its renewal. It initially states that the agreement is for one year following the launch date. However, it then introduces conflicting conditions regarding renewal. While it mentions that the agreement can be renewed by mutual written agreement, it also states that if neither party gives notice of non-renewal 30 days before the expiration date, the agreement is automatically renewed for another year. This automatic renewal clause contradicts the requirement for mutual written agreement, creating uncertainty about the actual renewal process. It is ambiguous whether the contract requires explicit mutual agreement to renew, or whether lack of explicit non-renewal is enough.

section: 6.5 LIMITS ON SUBLICENSING.  All rights (under any applicable intellectual property right) granted herein are not sublicenseable, transferable or assignable.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may use a third party web host, but all actions or failures to act of the web host that would be a breach of this Agreement, were the actions or failures to act taken by the applicable party, shall be deemed a breach of this Agreement.  In addition, 2TheMart may grant sublicenses to companies that 2TheMart has a business relationship with to the extent that 2TheMart Content is visible from such company's web-site through a link or other means.
explanation: This section initially states that all rights granted in the agreement are not sublicenseable, transferable, or assignable. However, it then provides exceptions that create a contradiction. While either party can use a third-party web host, effectively sublicensing a part of their responsibilities, it also states that 2TheMart may grant sublicenses to companies it has a business relationship with to the extent that 2TheMart Content is visible from such company's web-site through a link or other means. This permission for 2TheMart to grant sublicenses directly contradicts the initial statement that rights granted herein are not sublicenseable, leading to ambiguity and potential disputes over intellectual property rights.

section: 9. INDEMNITY.  Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party.  In addition, 2TheMart shall indemnify i-Escrow against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which i-Escrow may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from 2TheMart Content.  In addition, i-Escrow shall indemnify 2TheMart against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which 2TheMart may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from i-Escrow Content and or the Services provided to Customers.
explanation: The beginning of the section is unclear and not structured properly: Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party.
